author: E-mail: haberman@nytimes.com
body: It would seem only a matter of time before someone proposes that a New York street or highway or building be rechristened in honor of the late Senator Edward M. Kennedy. For one thing, few pastimes appeal to politicians more than naming sites after one another. They love it so much that they sometimes honor their own at places that don't even
title: NYC; The Art and Craft of the Political Game of Renaming
